resources.string: Disappointment for Culers as Xavis team are unable to start the 2023/24 season with a win.Raphinhas red card in the first half was matched with a dismissal for Getafes Mata in the second half.
Still not firing on all cylinders but Barça marked their league debut at the Estadi Olímpic with a valuable win against Cádiz thanks to late goals from Pedri and Ferran.

Breathless encounter in the Estadio de la Cerámica. Two early goals put Barça in control in the first half but Villarreal fought back to level things up at half time. In the second half the home side took the lead but a spirited comeback inspired by teenage sensation Lamine Yamal saw goals from Ferran and Lewandowski give the blaugranes an important win.

Debuts for Iñigo Martínez, João Cancelo and João Félix and a vital three points for the blaugranes thanks to goals from Kounde and Lewandowskis second half penalty. Xavi\s team have taken 10 points from a possible 12 at the start of the season but now the international break is upon us

Great display from the blaugranes on their return to action after the international break. Goals for João Félix and João Cancelo on their debuts in the starting XI and excellent performances from the team as a whole. Four wins in a row now in La Liga for Xavi Hernándezs men and their next challenge is to take that form into the Champions League where they kick off their campaign against Royal Antwerp on Tuesday in the Estadi Olímpic.
Comfortable win at the Estadi Olímpic for Barça as they take control in Group H of the Champions League thanks to a brace from João Félix, an own goal and strikers from Lewandowski and Gavi.

Barça looked dead and buried at 2-0 down to Celta with just 10 minutes remaining at the Estadi Olímpic. Xavis team had been second best until João Félixs brilliant pass allowed Lewandowki to pull one back. The momentum gathered and another from the Polish striker and an 89th minute winner from Cancelo sealed a memorable comeback win, Barças sixth victory in a row in all competitions this season!
The run of six wins in a row in all competitions comes to an end in Son Moix. Xavis team came from behind twice to take a point thanks to goals from Raphinha and second half substitute Fermín López.
An own goal, from all of people Sergio Ramos, was enough to give Barça a deserved win over Sevilla and send them back to the top of the table, momentarily at least.

Six points from two matches and a perfect start for Xavis team in this seasons Champions League. The blaugranes were not at their best against Porto in the Estádio do Dragão but Ferrans goal in injury time at the end of the first half was enough to collect all three points.

Xavis team showed great character to come back from 2–0 down and salvage a point. Goals from Lamine and Sergi Roberto helped the blaugranes avoid defeat in the final game before the upcoming international break.
Barça overcome a tricky test at home with a victory over Athletic that allows them to keep pace with the leaders in La Liga.
Two wins out of two at home with a third to come this Saturday at the Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys. The first Clásico of the season in La Liga is upon with Real Madrid the visitors

Disappointment for Xavi Hernández\s team after their first defeat of the season but they remain just four points behind joint leaders Girona and Real Madrid in the table with just 11 games of the campaign played.
Barça not at their best but they show character to steal victory in the 93rd minute thanks to Ronald Araujo\s great header from a Gundogan cross.
Barça miss out on booking a place in the last 16 after a 1–0 defeat in Hamburg against Shakhtar. Thoughts now turn to La Liga where they face Alavés at home in the Estadi Olímpic on Sunday
That win for Xavi Hernández\s team leaves them in third place in the table, just two points behind Real Madrid and four points behind leaders Girona.

The blaugranes remain in third place for the moment in the league behind Real Madrid and leaders Girona after Lejeune\s second half own goal cancelled out Unai López\s opener for Rayo.Barça were looking for a win after the international break but there is a still a long way to go in the league with important games against Atlético and Girona coming up.

A great night for Barça in Europe but now thoughts turn back to domestic matters. On Sunday comes a vital game in la Liga at the Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys against Atlético Madrid, a team who have also booked their place in the last 16 of the Champions League.

After the win in the Champions League in midweek, today was another chance to get back on track for the blaugranes. The goal from João Félix and the win will be a great confidence boost ahead of next week\s showdown with surprise package of the season.
After the disappointment of the defeat against Girona, Xavi\s team turn their attention back to Europe with Wednesdays trip to Royal Antwerp in the Champions League.
Barça through to the last 16 as group winners despite defeat in Belgium.Later winner from Ilenikhena gives Antwerp victory after the blaugranes had come from behind to equalise twice

Barça held in Mestalla - João Félix puts them ahead but Gulliamón equalises after a goalless first half The blaugranes have chances to win but come up against an inspired Mamardashvili in goal for Valencia

A topsy turvy game in the Estadi Olímpic ends with an important three points for the blaugranes.A to and fro encounter against Almería is decided by Sergi Roberto\s second goal and late winner to give the blaugranes their first win in four matches.
Barça start the year with a hard fought win thanks to second half goals from Ferran and Gundogan
Barça made to work hard by lower league Barbastro to book place in last 16 A late penalty from substitute Lewandowski turns out to be the winner for the blaugranes
Second half goals from Lewandowski and Lamine Yamal are enough to see off Osasuna in the Super Cup semi-final The victory sets up a final against Real Madrid on Sunday in Saudi Arabia

Barça suffer a blow with a heavy defeat in the Spanish Super Cup final against Real Madrid but there is no time for regrets as the blaugranes are back in action on Thursday in the Copa del Rey against Unionistas de Salamance away from home.
Barça fall behind in the first half but goals from Ferran, Kounde and Balde see them into the last eight In the second half 16 year old Pau Cubarsí makes his official debut for the blaugranes
Ferran Torres scores a hat trick to hand Barça a vital win away at Betis Betis come back from two down to level things up but João Félix and Ferran seal the victory
